summary: A letter from St. Edmund Hall, Oxford, to a prospective student (Miss) confirming receipt of her UCAS form and that she will not need another interview, with an offer to be made on the same terms as the previous year. The letter is signed by D. A. Wyatt and includes a London address.

persons.name: D. A. Wyatt
persons.context: Appears as the sender/signatory of a letter from St. Edmund Hall, Oxford, regarding a UCAS application.

events.title: Letter sent regarding UCAS application
events.description: D. A. Wyatt sends a letter to a prospective student confirming receipt of her UCAS form and that no further interview is required, with an offer to be made on same terms as previous year.

keyFacts: The document is a letter dated November 7, 1995, from St. Edmund Hall, Oxford.
It is addressed to a 'Miss' regarding her UCAS application, indicating she will not need another interview and will receive an offer on the same terms as the previous year.
The letter is signed by D. A. Wyatt and includes a London return address (SW1N 9DF).
The document appears to be unrelated to the Epstein case directly, but is included in the Epstein document set (EFTA00017868).
